Internship in Secuna

04 May 2022 » uncategorized

I spent summer, starting February until May 2022 interning at Secuna, the biggest and most trusted cybersecurity testing platform in the Philippines. Ever since high school, Information Security is top most desired field I want to work into. So, I apply for internship and sent my CV through their email. And later that day I was invited for Interview.

Internship

As an intern with Secuna, I worked in a Penetration Testing position and was responsible for helping organization identify vulnerabilities. I experienced working with other employees and co-interns who have the same position as mine. It is quite overwheling

During my internship with the company, I was given a week to finish a Udemy course named Web Application Penetration Testing which was authored by AJ Dumanhug, a CEO of the company. I learned new techniques which Iâ€™m not familiar with in the past. I also learned creating a pentesting report where you need to list down all the vulnerabilities you have found and specify the severity level, the impact and remediation of the vulnerability to the organization. I managed to finish the course in two days and got the certificate.

I also did a pentest on a specific web application target, created a pentesting report, and report it in front of other employees. It was very challenging experience as I am lacking on communication skills but I have managed it.

Conclusion

From my internship in Secuna, I was able to practice not only my technical skills, mental skills but also social skills as I worked with other employees and interns in the company. From the knowledges I got from the WAPT course I took, the experience from pentesting a web application to creating and presenting a pentest report is a huge help to build myself professionally as that skills and experiences will be useful in my future career in Information Security field.
